listing.description: Refined in style, Beech House is an impressive double-fronted family home featuring a spacious central hall. Its extensive kitchen and breakfast/family room offers open plan luxury, with French doors and a separate utility room leading outside to the detached triple garage. The sophisticated sitting room also features French doors, while the dining room and study are light and airy, thanks to large bay windows. The master bedroom boasts a private dressing room, accompanied by two more en suite bedrooms and two additional bedrooms, ensuring a sanctuary for everyone.About FoxhillsAway from Birmingham's urban sprawl lies the tranquil and affluent commuter village of Barnt Green, where our exclusive collection of mews, semi-detached homes, detached homes and apartments combine luxury living with laid-back rural charm.Boasting light and contemporary interiors, each two, three, four and five bedroom home offers all the space and high specification you're looking for. And with the city centre just 10 miles away, as well as a choice of local amenities and well-regarded schools on its leafy doorstep, the most fantastic lifestyle can be enjoyed at Foxhills.Even though Barnt Green is a mere 10 miles south of Birmingham, it retains a rural feel thanks to Lickey Hills Country Park, which over looks the village, Situated in the Bromsgrove district of Worcestershire, it's always been a haven for commuters who can benefit from a caf?, delicatessen, butcher, florist and a variety of restaurants and pubs on the high street just under half-a-mile from Foxhills. For more active pursuits, Barnt Green Sports Club offers tennis, badminton, squash and table tennis, while the Cricket Club is next door to Foxhills. You can also go walking, cycling and fishing at Cofton Hackett and Bittell Reservoirs alongside the Worcester and Birmingham canal. Foxhills is equally well-placed for a high standard of education, with excellent choices like St Andrew?S C.E. First School, Alvechurch C.E. Middle School and South Bromsgrove High School.Opening HoursIn the case of inclement weather, please call ahead. Sales office and showhome open Thursday to Tuesday from 10:30am to 5pm and 12.30pm to 5pm on Wednesdays.

Hereford Road is a tree lined street just 0.3 miles from Acton Main Line Station (Crossrail from 2018), 0.7 miles to Acton Central (Overground) and 0.8 miles from West Acton (Central Line). Ideally located to the A40, Westfield shopping centre and Ealing Broadway.

listing.description: Kirklees Hall is a superior Grade I listed building that has been sympathetically renovated during the 1990's to create a select few, grand yet comfortable homes set in large, well maintained grounds. Carr House is a five bedroom property situated within this prestigious country house estate and has the advantage of countryside living with local motorway access as well as beautiful period features throughout and a fascinating history.Set over three levels this property briefly comprises: Grand entrance hall with double 'flying' staircase by Carr of York (one of the Country's most highly regarded Georgian architects), large drawing/living room with oak panels, grand dining room and high quality dining kitchen. To the first floor there is a double bedroom with additional children's bedroom/dressing room off, further double bedroom with long distance views and large master bedroom which is currently used as living area. There are two bathrooms and guest suite to the lower ground with two bedrooms, bathroom including sauna with additional store rooms and cellar.Leeds and Manchester accessible via M62 motorway (Leeds approx. 15 miles, Manchester approx. 33 miles).Kirklees Hall was built in the 16th Century by Sir Thomas Gargrave and then bought by the Armytage family shortly after. The foundations on the original hall (Carr House) were taken from the old Kirklees Priory, which stood only 100 meters from the hall, and was demolished by Cromwell during the Protestant/Catholic turmoil. There is evidence that Charlotte Bronte frequently visited Kirklees Hall, and the hall is mentioned in some of her books. In the grounds of Kirklees Hall estate is the grave of Robin Hood. It is said that his Aunt was the prioress of the priory and was known for her healing powers by way of blood letting.

listing.description: Situated in a private cul-de-sac in the village of Chorleywood is this four bedroom detached residence. To the ground floor are two receptions rooms which has been made into a light filled open plan through lounge to dining room measuring approximately 30ft. The ground floor also benefits from another reception room, 20ft kitchen dining room, utility and double garage.To the first floor there is a master bedroom with modern fitted ensuite which is supported by three further double bedrooms and a four piece family bathroom. This terrific residence is completed by a detached multi purpose studio with shower and sauna room.Chorleywood village with its eclectic mix of shops, cafés is approximately half a mile away. The station provides a frequent service to London Baker Street and The City as well as the Chiltern Turbo to Marylebone. Communications are excellent with junction 18 of the M25 close by with links to the major motorway network and airports. The area is well served by highly regarded private and state schools for all ages. Chorleywood offers everything for a sporting life; from cricket, football, tennis, horse riding and golf. Water sports are also available at the Aquadrome in Rickmansworth.- cul-de-sac location- four bedrooms- two reception rooms- large kitchen/ dining room- double garage- detached studio- driveway - landscaped rear garden

listing.description: A substantial and attractive 1930’s built family home which has been successfully extended, remodelled and improved, now offering very adaptable three storey accommodation. Due to specific circumstances the house has been extended to accommodate two families and is therefore slightly unusual.Currently, there is an impressive kitchen/dining/living room and adjacent to that is a second kitchen/dining/family room with two bedrooms and bathroom which is being used as a self-contained annexe. Alternatively, a quick glance at the floorplan will demonstrate that this area could be utilised differently. The kitchen could be removed and the room become the principal living room with the ground floor bedrooms used as reception rooms, as required. The rear extension has attractive ceiling lanterns in two of the rooms which provide excellent natural light and bi-fold doors open to the rear decking from the family area, living room and main ground floor bedroom.The first floor has a useful study area currently operating as an office with workstation, plus there are two bedrooms and shower room. The second floor has been converted into the master bedroom with twin wardrobe cupboards, stylish en-suite bathroom and there is a Juliet balcony. The house is superbly presented with fresh and modern décor, stylish contemporary bath/shower rooms (with rainhead showers, double cubicles and a free-standing bath to the en-suite bathroom) and kitchens which is balanced with some original features such as leaded light windows, although the extended rooms have double glazed leaded lights units.The main kitchen features numerous integrated appliances, induction hob, Corian worktops and high gloss units. There are also large porcelain tiles throughout the kitchen/dining/living room and the second kitchen/family room and off the main kitchen is a utility/boot room.Crystal chandeliers in all the main reception areas plus some rooms feature chrome downlighters and every room has chrome sockets, switches etc.Outside, is an adjacent garage, ample off road parking on a shingle driveway, whilst the substantial rear garden has a large timber decking, pergola, shed and lawn.The location is hugely convenient being within a half mile radius to Woking centre and station.Woking has a thriving town centre offering extensive shopping, dining and leisure facilities including The New Victoria Theatre & Cinema, and the Lightbox Gallery. For golfers there is a choice of clubs including, Woking Golf Club (one of the oldest in the U.K. Founded in 1893), Westhill, Hoebridge, Worplesdon, Chobham and Foxhills (including spa and hotel). Both the Basingstoke Canal and the River Wey are close by for walking, cycling and fishing (permit required), whilst nearby Chobham Common is a National Nature Reserve.The area is well served by both state and private schools including: Hoebridge, St Andrews, Greenfield, Halstead, Woking High School, St Dunstan’s and St John the Baptist School.Substantially Extended Aand Flexible AccommodationOpen plan Kitchen/Dining/Living RoomSecond Open Plan Kitchen/Dining/Family RoomTwo Ground Floor BedroomsGround Floor BathroomTwo First Floor Bedrooms And StudyFirst Floor Shower And CloakroomSecond Floor Master Bedroom With En-Suite Bathroom

listing.description: This two double bedroom penthouse apartment boasts a stunning finish thanks to a recent make-over by the current owners, which will appeal to all tastes.The living area is semi open-plan, with a cleverly designed 3rd bedroom/office just off it with a pull down bed and sliding doors to partition the room off. Leading up from here is a well equipped kitchen/dining area complete with a built in full size wine fridge and seamless sliding glass doors out onto the roof terrace. This wonderful roof terrace is a lovely natural extension to the kitchen and has panoramic views across London making it perfect for al fresco dinning, entertaining or simple watching the fireworks. The master bedroom is a good size and has handy built in wardrobes either side of the entrance to the en suite and a double second bedroom and family bathroom down the hallway.The property further benefits from underfloor heating and ac in the kitchen and lounge, a secure underground parking space, access to a beautiful communal roof terrace with river views and a long lease.SituationChatfield Road sits just below the river, with all of the amenities of the riverfront including the Michelin Starred 'Gazette' restaurant just a short walk away. Transport links are similarly impressive with Clapham Junction a short walk away and several bus routes passing close by on York Road.

listing.short_description:
Home Estate Agents are privileged to offer for sale this elegant, double fronted detached Edwardian residence providing very spacious and well proportioned accommodation with an immense amount of character incorporating many original period features.

The accommodation comprises, a wonderful reception hall with galleried landing, drawing room, formal dining room, study, morning room, kitchen/breakfast room, laundry room, conservatory and cloakroom/wc. There are five bedrooms on the first floor, two of which enjoy en-suite facilities and there is also a family bathroom. The second floor incorporates a living area and bedroom providing tremendous scope to enhance further should a purchaser so desire. Set in large, mature, west backing gardens extending to approximately 100 feet in length with an additional 'L' shaped return and located on the much sought after 'Chalkwell Hall Estate' conveniently close to an excellent range of amenities including shops, schools, parks and ideal for commuting to the city with Westcliff being within a short walk. Viewing highly recommended.
